item.text: The beneficiary's clinical classification

valueCoding.display: C0 - No visible or palpable signs of venous disease
C1 - Telangiectasias, reticular veins
C2 - Varicose veins
C2r - Recurrent varicose veins
C3 - Edema
C4 - Changes in skin and subcutaneous tissue
C4a - Pigmentation or eczema
C4b - Lipodermatosclerosis or atrophie blanche
C4c - Corona phlebectatica
C5 - Healed
C6 - Active venous ulcer
C6r - Recurrent active venous ulcer
S - With symptoms attributable to venous disease
A - Absence of symptoms attributable to venous disease
NA - Not required by LCD

item.text: Documentation demonstrates clinical findings that support CEAP C2  - C6 disease AND reflux is present per diagnostic test results documentation.

Bleeding from diseased vessels of the lower extremities
